verses.kjv: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;
verses.ct: These are the proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel.

verses.kjv: To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;
verses.ct: Their purpose is to teach wisdom and discipline, and to help people grasp words of insight.

verses.kjv: To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;
verses.ct: They provide training in wise living, in doing what is right, just, and fair.

verses.kjv: To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.
verses.ct: They give shrewdness to the inexperienced, and knowledge and good judgment to the young.

verses.kjv: A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:
verses.ct: Someone who is already wise will listen and grow even wiser, and a person with understanding will gain skilled guidance.

verses.kjv: To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.
verses.ct: They help you interpret proverbs and parables — the sayings of the wise and their riddles.

verses.kjv: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.ct: Wholehearted dedication to the LORD is the foundation of knowledge, but fools reject wisdom and discipline.

verses.kjv: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
verses.ct: My son, pay attention to your father's teaching, and don't abandon your mother's instruction.

verses.kjv: For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.
verses.ct: They will be like a beautiful wreath on your head and a fine chain around your neck.

verses.kjv: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.
verses.ct: My son, if sinful people try to lure you in, don't go along with them.

verses.kjv: If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:
verses.ct: If they say, 'Come with us! Let's ambush someone and attack the innocent for no reason.

verses.kjv: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:
verses.ct: We'll swallow them alive like the grave, whole and healthy like those who drop into the pit.

verses.kjv: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:
verses.ct: We'll grab every kind of valuable treasure and stuff our houses with stolen goods.

verses.kjv: Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:
verses.ct: Throw in your lot with us — we'll all share one money bag.'

verses.kjv: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:
verses.ct: My son, don't go down that road with them. Keep your feet off their path.

verses.kjv: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.
verses.ct: Because they rush toward evil and hurry to spill blood.

verses.kjv: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.
verses.ct: It's pointless to set a trap in plain sight of a bird.

verses.kjv: And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.
verses.ct: But these people are actually setting an ambush for themselves — they're stalking their own lives.

verses.kjv: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.
verses.ct: This is what happens to everyone greedy for unjust profit — it ends up destroying the very person who takes it.

verses.kjv: Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:
verses.ct: Wisdom calls out in public; she raises her voice in the open squares.

verses.kjv: She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,
verses.ct: She shouts at the busiest intersections, at the city gates she delivers her message:

verses.kjv: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?
verses.ct: "How long will you naive people cling to your ignorance? How long will mockers enjoy their mocking and fools despise knowledge?

verses.kjv: Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.
verses.ct: Respond to my correction! Look — I will pour out my spirit on you and reveal my thoughts to you.

verses.kjv: Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;
verses.ct: But I called out and you refused to listen. I reached out my hand and no one paid attention.

verses.kjv: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:
verses.ct: You ignored all my advice and rejected every correction I offered.

verses.kjv: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;
verses.ct: So I will laugh when disaster hits you. I will mock when the thing you dread arrives —

verses.kjv: When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.
verses.ct: when terror sweeps over you like a storm, when catastrophe strikes like a whirlwind, when suffering and anguish overwhelm you.

verses.kjv: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:
verses.ct: At that point they will cry out to me, but I won't answer. They will search desperately for me but won't find me.

verses.kjv: For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the LORD:
verses.ct: Because they hated knowledge and refused to choose wholehearted dedication to the LORD.

verses.kjv: They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.
verses.ct: They wanted nothing to do with my advice and rejected all my correction.

verses.kjv: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.
verses.ct: So they will eat the bitter fruit of their own choices and be stuffed full of the consequences of their own schemes.

verses.kjv: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.
verses.ct: The stubbornness of the naive will kill them, and the complacency of fools will destroy them.

verses.kjv: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
verses.ct: But whoever listens to me will live in safety, completely at ease and free from the dread of disaster."
